It doesn't appear to be a new bug. I can reproduce it in the 3.0 release, too.

Created an attachment (id=15970)
patch to org.eclipse.debug.ui

Memory View did not anticipate having IDebugElement.getDebugTarget to return
null.  Added checks to avoid null pointer exceptions.

Applie patch. NOTE: according to the API, the only time a debug element is 
allowed to return null for #getDebugTarget() is when an IExpression is not 
bound to a specific debug target. All other debug elements are specified to be 
bound to a debug target.

Ken, in this case, what kind of debug element is returning null for its debug 
target? If it is a memory block, should we also make a note on its API to say 
that its debug target may be null?

The null-returning element that I noticed (in the v3.0 code) was an expression
in the expression view. If the API documention already notes this case, it would
seem that there is no need for any additional documentation.

Samantha, can you confirm that, in the latest code, the null debug target comes
from an expression?

Confirmed that the null-returning element comes from a watchpoint expression 
from the Expressions View when there is no debug session.  IMemoryBlock would 
always be able to return an IDebugTarget. So, there is no need to add that to 
the documentation.
Sorry... typo.. I mean it comes from a watch expression.
